Class CashRegister

  • java.lang.Object
    • CashRegister

  • public class CashRegister
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to represent a cash register that holds BillTypes
    Author:
    David Harmeyer

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) BillType[] billTypes
      An array of BillTypes that holds a billType for $100, $50, $20, $10, $5, and $1 in that order

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CashRegister()
      The default constructor for a CashRegister that starts with a fully stocked CashRegister

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getPrintoutOfBill(int value)
      Gets a string representing the value of a certain BillType, which is searched for by value.
      void restock()
      Restocks all billTypes so that they each have 10 bills
      java.lang.String toString()
      A string the represents the full state of this CashRegister
      void withdrawAmount(int amount)
      Withdraws the specified amount from this CashRegister using the least bills possible.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

        BillType[] billTypes

      • CashRegister

        public CashRegister()
        The default constructor for a CashRegister that starts with a fully stocked CashRegister

    • Method Detail

      • restock

        public void restock()
        Restocks all billTypes so that they each have 10 bills

      • withdrawAmount

        public void withdrawAmount(int amount)
                    throws InsufficientCashException
        Withdraws the specified amount from this CashRegister using the least bills possible. This is done using a greedy algorithm. Although this would not work for the general case (id est if bills of any) the U. S. change system has been proven to be canonical, and this system therefore works with these denominations of bills, and would also work if two dollar bills were used.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to be withdrawn
        Throws:
        InsufficientCashException - An exception if there is not a sufficient amount of cash in the register to make the cash

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A string the represents the full state of this CashRegister
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getPrintoutOfBill

        public java.lang.String getPrintoutOfBill(int value)
        Gets a string representing the value of a certain BillType, which is searched for by value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value of that BillType
        Returns:
        A string representing the value and quantity of the BillType with the sepcified value.
